intro: Way back in Bible times, a man named Jesse had several sons. Tell us what you know about Jesse's boys.

questions.ask: What youngest boy of Jesse was anointed by the prophet Samuel to be king?
What town, where years later Jesus would be born, was home to Jesse's boys?
What enemies were Jesse's oldest boys, as members of the Israelite army, opposing in the Valley of Elah?
How many boys in all did Jesse have?
Who was Jesse's firstborn boy?

intro: They say that diamonds are a girl's best friend... but God must like jewels, too. What do you recall of the precious stones scattered through the pages of the Bible?

questions.ask: What valuable red stones, according to Proverbs, are worth less than either wisdom or a good wife?
What green stone resembles the rainbow circling God's throne in heaven?
How many precious stones, representing the tribes of Israel, were part of the breastplate worn by Old Testament priests?
What jewel did Jesus warn against throwing to pigs?
What part of the city wall of the New Jerusalem is decorated with precious stones?

intro: You probably know something about the suffering saint named Job... but do you know enough to complete this quiz? Let's find out!

questions.ask: What accuser received God's permission to attack Job's possessions, family, and health?
What four words of (bad) advice did Job's wife have for her husband?
How Job, defending God's right to give and take away, describe himself upon entering and departing this world?
What was the two-letter name of Job's homeland?
What trio of friends offered Job plenty of advice but little comfort throughout his trails?

intro: Okay, we're making this easy for you. The quotation marks give you an automatic hint to the answers to these questions: They'll all start with the letter J

questions.ask: What was the first name of the traitorous disciple Iscariot?
What son of Saul loved his friend David "as himself"?
What synagogue official saw his twelve-year-old daughter raised to life by Jesus?
What priest of Midian was father-in-law to Moses?
What woman helped Deborah earn a complete military victory by driving a tent peg through the head of the sleeping enemy commander, Sisera?
